system.description:
This spell-song functions similarly to a bless spell, providing combat and morale benefits to the bard and nearby allies. However, the bard must continue singing for the effect to remain active.

Effects:

  • All affected creatures gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and +1 to damage rolls.
  • They also gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws.
  • Morale is improved, granting a +1 bonus to morale checks.

Duration:

  • The bard may sing for a number of rounds equal to his or her Constitution score.
  • If the bard exceeds this limit, he or she will fall unconscious for 1d4 turns [[/r 1d4 #Unconscious Turns]].
  • If the bard stops singing before reaching the limit, there are no ill effects.

Area of Effect:

  • Affects the bard and all allies within 10' + 2' per bard level.
